page.title: 14ARMED FORCES
page.content:
{Penhale Army Training Camp}was built in l938 and during the Second World War was used for artillery supplies and for training American soldiers with coastal guns. On 7th July, l940, the camp was bombed and 7 people were killed instantly. Later 24 more soldiers were killed as they checked other bombs which had been set with timing devices. Today the camp is used for training all kinds of soldiers such as Cadets, Territorial Army, Marines and the Navy.
Some of the land has been sold to the National Trust for use as a car park. Of the remaining 2000 acres, l0l buildings occupy 500 acres. When full to capacity the camp can accommodate 800 persons.
